TIMOTHY SCHMIEG is a Customer Service Project Leader with extensive experience in project administration, technical support and coordination of customer service operations. He has the ability to build and motivate personnel while resolving technical and administrative problems. He was viewed as a resource expert while working on federal and national help desk support groups to provide a high customer satisfaction rate for the perspective companies he represented. 
Tim specializes in coordination of asset control programs while understanding new technology that entered the desktop and network computer markets. He managed mobile and demonstration facilities, which included account planning, change management of all hardware and software products. Improved customer desktop skills by providing comprehensive technical support for classroom instructional equipment. Organize marketing account teams for trade shows while achieving market driven program objectives. 
Tim received his BA in History and minor in Business Administration from Radford University in Radford, Va.. He took professional and technical coursework while working for IBM.  
Tim’s professional experience included information technology, project administration, and customer service with IBM.
